intro: Euphrasia amphisysepala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
